metadata.title: CVE-2024-8235 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in libvirt. A refactor of the code fetching the list ofinterfaces for multiple APIs introduced a corner case on platforms whereallocating 0 bytes of memory results in a NULL pointer. This corner casewould lead to a NULL-pointer dereference and subsequent crash ofvirtinterfaced. This issue could allow clients connecting to the read-onlysocket to crash the virtinterfaced daemon.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-8235` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-libvirt - 6.0.0-0ubuntu8.20
libvirt-clients - 6.0.0-0ubuntu8.20
libvirt-daemon - 6.0.0-0ubuntu8.20
libvirt-daemon-driver-lxc - 6.0.0-0ubuntu8.20
libvirt-daemon-driver-qemu - 6.0.0-0ubuntu8.20
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-gluster - 6.0.0-0ubuntu8.20
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-rbd - 6.0.0-0ubuntu8.20
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-zfs - 6.0.0-0ubuntu8.20
libvirt-daemon-driver-vbox - 6.0.0-0ubuntu8.20
libvirt-daemon-driver-xen - 6.0.0-0ubuntu8.20
libvirt-daemon-system - 6.0.0-0ubuntu8.20
libvirt-daemon-system-systemd - 6.0.0-0ubuntu8.20
libvirt-daemon-system-sysv - 6.0.0-0ubuntu8.20
libvirt-sanlock - 6.0.0-0ubuntu8.20
libvirt-wireshark - 6.0.0-0ubuntu8.20
libvirt0 - 6.0.0-0ubuntu8.20
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvirt package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.0-0ubuntu8.20').
